title: The Athletic weekly live coverage : NFL games on Christmas , AFCON , and more
body_text:
Even the hectic holiday festivities cannot slow down another week of engaging live coverage at The Athletic including the Africa Cup of Nations, three NFL games on Christmas, Manchester United versus Newcastle and much more.
You don’t want to miss a moment of our extensive coverage as each blog features the latest news, play-by-play, reaction, analysis and more.
Advertisement
We welcome you to share your views, predictions and more in the comments below. Your responses could be featured in our coverage throughout the week, so stay tuned and get involved. You can also get in contact with the team by emailing live@theathletic.com.
Here is the full live schedule for the week of Dec. 22 to 29.
Monday
AFCON 2025 – South Africa vs. Angola
Play in Group B begins with an intriguing matchup between two sides looking to build on their success at the last AFCON. South Africa finished third in 2023 after losing to Nigeria in the semifinal on penalties while Angola was bounced by this same Nigerian squad a round earlier.
Our live coverage begins at 9 a.m. ET.
AFCON 2025 – Egypt vs. Zimbabwe
After flying through the group stages at AFCON 2023, Egypt was eliminated in the round of 16, losing to the Democratic Republic of Congo in a dramatic penalty shootout. Mohamed Salah’s relationship with Liverpool and Arne Slot has been under a microscope in recent weeks and the star winger likely enters AFCON with a lot he wants to prove.
Zimbabwe was suspended by FIFA during the last tournament and will look to make some noise in its return to AFCON.
Our live coverage begins at 12 p.m. ET.
“Monday Night Football” — 49ers vs. Colts
Philip Rivers aims to lead the Colts to a win as Indianapolis has lost four straight games and has not been victorious since Week 10. Conversely, San Francisco has won four straight games and clinched a playoff spot Sunday thanks to Detroit’s home loss to Pittsburgh.
Our live coverage begins at 3 p.m. ET.
Tuesday
AFCON 2025 – Nigeria vs. Tanzania
Nigeria had an extremely successful run at AFCON 2023 but it ended in heartbreak, losing 2-1 in the final against Ivory Coast thanks to a tournament-winning goal by Sebastian Haller in the 83rd minute.
Advertisement
Tanzania, who did not make it out of the group stages in 2023 after a loss and two draws, will aim to start its tournament with a stunning upset against one of the favorites.
Our live coverage begins at 7 a.m. ET.
Wednesday
AFCON 2025 – Ivory Coast vs. Mozambique
The defending AFCON champions will begin their title defense against Mozambique, who did not make it through the group stages at the last tournament.
Our live coverage begins at 2 p.m. ET.
Thursday
Cowboys vs. Commanders
NFL action on Christmas day begins with a battle of two NFC East rivals playing for pride as both the Commanders and Cowboys have already been eliminated from playoff contention.
Dallas is coming off a home loss to the Los Angeles Chargers while Washington lost to the Philadelphia Eagles at home in Week 16.
Our live coverage begins at 11 a.m. ET.
Lions vs. Vikings
Minnesota has won three straight games all of a sudden thanks to the improved play of rookie quarterback J.J. McCarthy, who exited the Vikings Week 16 win over the New York Giants with a hand injury.
Detroit rolls into town needing a win to salvage its fading playoff hopes in the NFC, coming off a frustrating home loss against the Pittsburgh Steelers.
Our live coverage begins at 2 p.m. ET.
Broncos vs. Chiefs
Denver, fresh off its first loss since Week 3, is aiming to secure the top seed in the AFC, facing a depleted Kansas City offense that is down to its third-string quarterback after the Chiefs were dominated by the Titans in Week 16.
Our live coverage begins at 6 p.m. ET.
Friday
Premier League – Manchester United vs. Newcastle
Morgan Rogers gave Manchester United fits on Sunday, scoring a brace as Aston Villa maintained its remarkable form in the Premier League with a 2-1 win.
Newcastle is coming off a 2-2 draw against Chelsea in which Nick Woltemade scored two early before goals from Reece James and Joao Pedro tied the match in the second half.
Our live coverage begins at 12 p.m. ET.
Saturday
AFCON 2025- Nigeria vs. Tunisia
Action in Group B continues as Nigeria faces Tunisia at Fez Stadium.
Our live coverage begins at 10 a.m. ET.
Advertisement
Texans vs. Chargers
Houston has not lost since Week 9, attempting to track down the Jacksonville Jaguars in the race for the AFC South crown and coming off a home victory against the Las Vegas Raiders.
Los Angeles also enters on a winning streak, most recently dismantling the Cowboys in Dallas behind a 300-yard game from Justin Herbert.
Our live coverage begins at 2 p.m. ET.
Ravens vs. Packers
Green Bay is coming off a frustrating overtime loss to the Chicago Bears and are quickly fading in the NFC playoff picture. The Packers may also be without Jordan Love after he suffered a concussion in Week 16.
Baltimore is now on the brink of being eliminated from playoff contention after a frustrating 28-24 loss to New England at home in which Lamar Jackson exited with a back injury.
Our live coverage begins at 5 p.m. ET.
Sunday
‘Battle of the Sexes’
The top-ranked women’s tennis player in the world, Aryna Sabalenka, faces off against Nick Kyrgios in an exhibition match at Coca-Cola Arena in Dubai. The event is intended to be a sequel of the original “Battle of the Sexes,” in which Billie Jean King beat Bobby Riggs in 1973.
Our live coverage begins at 7 a.m. ET.
NFL news and scores
Stay updated on all the latest news around the NFL in real time from our team of reporters across the league with our catch-all blog, which will be live from before kickoff of the 1 p.m. ET slate through “Sunday Night Football.”
Our live coverage begins at 10 a.m ET.
“Sunday Night Football” – Bears vs. 49ers
Chicago is having a magical season and the vibes will be at an all time high if the Bears can get a win in San Francisco to clinch the NFC North.
Meanwhile, the 49ers will play on prime time for the second time this week as Kyle Shanahan’s squad attempts to build momentum toward a successful playoff run.
Our live coverage begins at 5 p.m. ET.
